item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: India, Auckland Region, National, Health, Immigration
item.title: 'My heart breaks': Dying mum pleads for someone to look after her daughter
item.description:
Straining to speak under the weight of her own breath, Rizwana Shaikh talked about the fact she was dying only in terms of her children's future.
The Auckland mother-of-two gasped in words, not sentences ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/SCCZEN_220520NZHRIZWANA3_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Rizwana Shaikh and her 3-year-old disabled daughter, Alisha, in the Mt Roskill home of a friend. Photo / Fiona Goodall

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2220_70x71.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Rizwana Shaikh, right, and her 3-year-old disabled daughter, Alisha, held by her friend Aminah Khaled, left. Rizwana has terminal ovarian cancer. Photo / Fiona Goodall, Getty Images

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/IMG_2737_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Rizwana Shaikh holding her 5-year-old son Aabir and 3-year-old daughter Alisha who has been disabled since birth. Photo / Supplied
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/IMG_2739_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Rizwana Shaikh with her 5-year-old son Aabir. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2220_70x70.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Rizwana Shaikh and her 3-year-old disabled daughter, Alisha, in the Mt Roskill home of a friend. 22 May 2020 Photo: Fiona Goodall/Getty Images

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/thumbnail_IMG_5187_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Three-year-old Alisha Shaikh lives with a range of severe disabilities and is wheelchair-bound but is described as an extremely affectionate child by all who know her. Photo / Supplied

item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: Newmarket, Auckland Region, National, Transport, Roads, Public Transport
item.title: 'Money grab' - Auckland Transport pockets $4.6m off single bus lane trial
item.description:
Auckland Transport has pocketed an additional $4.6 million in fines from motorists in just three months, after extending the restrictions on a single poorly painted bus lane to include non-peak hours.
The ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2217_70x73.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Damian Christie appealed to AT to waive the $150 fine which arrived during the middle of lockdown but was refused. 21 May 2020 New Zealand Herald photograph by Sylvie Whinray

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2217_70x72.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Auckland motorist Damian Christie was nabbed the $150 fine on a Saturday morning in February while driving along what he says were empty roads. 21 May 2020 NZ Herald photo by Sylvie Whinray

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2217_70x71.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Auckland Transport says it is not a legal requirement for bus lanes to be painted green. 21 May 2020 New Zealand Herald photograph by Sylvie Whinray

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2217_70x70.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The patchy paint job of the Khyber Pass Road bus lane in Newmarket, Auckland. 21 May 2020 New Zealand Herald photograph by Sylvie Whinray

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2118_70x73.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Motorists have complained about the lack of adequate signage and green paint to indicate the presence of the Khyber Pass Rd bus lane in Newmarket, Auckland. SUPPLIED

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2118_70x72.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=One of signs indicating the Khyber Pass Rd bus lane is bent 90 degrees away from oncoming drivers so they can't see it. SUPPLIED

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2118_70x71.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Motorists have complained about the lack of adequate signage and green paint to indicate the presence of the Khyber Pass Rd bus lane in Newmarket, Auckland. SUPPLIED

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/Screenshot2020-05-2118_70x70.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The paint on the Khyber Pass Rd bus and transit lane in Newmarket is peeling off from wear. SUPPLIED

item.description:

It removes boundaries and allows unchecked creative freedom - which sounds good in theory.
